{{lowercase|title=eTouch Systems}} {{Infobox company | company_name = eTouch Systems | company_logo = [[File:ETouch_Systems_Logo.png|175px|eTouch Systems]] | foundation = 1998 | key_people = Aniruddha Gadre
CEO & Founder | location = [[Fremont, California]], [[California]], [[USA]] | industry = [[IT service management|IT services]], [[Information technology consulting|IT consulting]] | area_served = Worldwide | services = Enterprise Web,
Big Data,
Mobility,
Test Engineering,
Business Intelligence and Data Management,
Outsourcing | products = [[SamePage]] | num_employees = 500+ | homepage = [http://www.etouchconsulting.com/ etouchconsulting.com], [http://www.etouch.net/ etouch.net] }} '''eTouch Systems''', based in [[Fremont, California|Fremont]], [[California]], U.S.A., is a provider of consulting services and [[enterprise wiki]] [[solution]]s. The company was founded in 1998 and is a privately owned corporation. Its CEO is Aniruddha Gadre. eTouch Systems has two main streams of business: services and products. The company's offerings cover Enterprise Web, Big Data, Mobility, Test Engineering, Business Intelligence, Data Management and Outsourcing. The company introduced its J2EE-based enterprise wiki and blog software, [[SamePage]], in 2006. ==Services offerings== Their customer base spans numerous industries, with a concentration in data-intensive industries like high-technology, life-sciences, financial services, retail, manufacturing, government agencies, and other industries. *Enterprise Web *Big Data *Mobility *Test Engineering *Business Intelligence and Data Management *Outsourcing ==Products== ===SamePage=== [[File:ETouch-SamePage-Logo.png|right|250px|eTouch Samepage Logo.]] SamePage was developed based on eTouch's domain experience in content management systems created for enterprises and organizations such as [[Cisco Systems]], [[Johnson & Johnson]], and [[Alcatel-Lucent]]. Since 2002, eTouch has been the primary contractor for managing [[NASA]]'s public web portal. Multiple teams at NASA use eTouch SamePage for internal collaboration to support space missions."NASA Internet portal takes hits", ''Oakland Tribune'', Jan 8, 2004 by Edward DeMarco, Bloomberg News Other SamePage clients and partners include [[Citrix]], Hestia, Teradyne, [[Siemens]], NY State Unified Court System, [[Automatic Data Processing|ADP]] and [[WebEx]], a part of [[Cisco]]. [http://www.cmswire.com/cms/enterprise-20/the-saas-deployment-model-offered-in-an-on-premise-wiki-003946.php The SaaS Deployment Model Offered in an On Premise Wiki - CMS Wire, Feb. 13, 2009] ==Offices and presence== eTouch Systems has its headquarters in USA. Its development centers are located in India at Mumbai and Pune. ==External links== *[http://www.etouchconsulting.com/ etouchconsulting.com] *[http://www.etouch.net/ etouch.net] ==References== *[http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/etouch-system-joins-google-enterprise-partner-program-186394501.html PR Newswire - eTouch System Joins Google Enterprise Partner Program] *"Google Buys Wiki Maker", ''San Jose Mercury News'', Nov. 11, 2006 by Ryan Blitstein *[http://www.cmswire.com/cms/micro-cms/enterprise-wikis-another-way-to-get-on-the-same-page-000933.php Enterprise Wikis: Another Way to Get on the Same Page - CMS Wire, Nov. 28, 2006 by Angela Natividad] *[http://www.collaborationloop.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=1816&Itemid=45 eTouch Releases SamePage 3.0 - Collaboration Loop, Nov. 28, 2006] {{reflist}} [[Category:Companies established in 1998]] [[Category:Companies based in Fremont, California]] [[Category:Wiki software]] [[Category:Computer companies of the United States]] [[Category:Software companies based in the San Francisco Bay Area]] [[Category:Fremont, California]] [[Category:Companies based in Mumbai]] [[Category:Software companies in India]] [[Category:Information technology consulting firms of India]] [[Category:Software companies based in Mumbai]]
